metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23968 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
If Content Security Policy blocked frame navigation, the full destinationof a redirect served in the frame was reported in the violation report; asopposed to the original frame URI. This could be used to leak sensitiveinformation contained in such URIs. This vulnerability affects Firefox <86, Thunderbird < 78.8, and Firefox ESR < 78.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23968` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
